channel.title: Oneplus One on Bennett Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Oneplus One on Bennett Notes

item.title: Bypass Android Lock screen
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: Locked out of your phone? Well you are in luck. There is a way to bypass your Android lock screen. Now before you get too excited, there are a few stipulations. First, this only works when your security is set to pattern lock. Secondly, you must have a rooted android device. And finally, you need to have adb debugging enabled. I know this might only be a small percentage of people out there, so for those of you who do, here’s how you can bypass Android lock screen.

item.title: Adobe Flash Player Android Lollipop
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: Adobe Flash Player Android Lollipop: At one time, Android fully supported adobe flash player. However, official support ended by the time KitKat was released (though there were still a few hacks that you could use to get it). Of course, HTML5 video players are the preferred option, but unfortunately, there are some porn sites that still rely heavily on adobe flash content. [adinserter block=”5″]   Well, if you have an Android device running Lollipop you can now access the flash content once more.

item.title: Tor for Android
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: Let’s talk about internet privacy. So as you might be aware of, when you open up a tab in incognito mode you’re not really browsing anonymously. Your ISP and and any one else who is monitoring your internet can get your location and see the sites you visited. To truly browse the internet privately, you need to use tor. [adinserter block=”5″] To keep it brief, Tor is a mesh of proxy servers that bounces your IP to different locations across the globe.
